speaker: ANGELA
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, nothing I've seen convinces me there's a monster … don't think we can assume George Vincent gave us a factual account of what took place in his apartment. ]

speaker: ANGELA
line: I know you probably can't hear me but no listening anyway, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, something welled up out of the uncharted depths of the ocean-- something that had been lying there undiscovered for ages, probably.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there is no evidence of any creature here. Those organisms might just simply be waterborne parasites, but something from Jules Verne they are not.

speaker: ANGELA
line: I saw it! I saw it! It's in the tub with the deputy. It has giant arms like an octopus.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: GEORGE
line: What the hell is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's gone?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. He's gone. The deputy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where'd he go?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think the deputy went out with the bathwater.

speaker: GEORGE
line: And he was... he was in there with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I don't think he was.

speaker: WALTER
line: Well, she said she saw it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure she did. Look, Scully, I think I know why nobody's ever seen this thing before. It, it just doesn't live in water. It is water, taking shape only when it attacks, like it did when the hurricane backed seawater into the plumbing. Virtually unseeable until then.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if that were true then this wouldn't be visible, would it? I mean, what this is showing us is that water actually attempts to kill it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe you just impeded its reproductive process. Maybe it needs time to complete its cycle like it had with the Shipleys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the Shipleys weren't even in their house.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, they were when they were attacked just like the deputy was here-- using their bodies to lay its own spawn-- using the body's water content to reproduce itself-- to make itself anew.

speaker: WALTER
line: You mean, he turned into one of those things?

speaker: ANGELA
line: There are more of them?

speaker: MULDER
line: We got to get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're in the middle of a hurricane.

speaker: MULDER
line: We got to get to another building.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we cant. There's no way we can transport everybody.

speaker: MULDER
line: We can use the deputy's Prowler. How many people? We got two, four... … son of a bitch.

speaker: WALTER
line: The looter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if we're going to leave we should leave now.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING
line: MULDER: He took the Prowler, Scully.]

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?! Hey, Mulder, are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey... wait a second. What are you doing?!

speaker: GEORGE
line: I am saving our lives.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's my partner out there!

speaker: GEORGE
line: If he's your partner he should have listened to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can't just leave him there!

speaker: GEORGE
line: I'm not letting him in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He'll die!

speaker: WALTER
line: What are you going to do for him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I can at least keep him breathing!

speaker: WALTER
line: You couldn't save the deputy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, at least let me try. I'm a medical doctor.

speaker: ANGELA
line: That's good... because my water just broke.

speaker: WALTER
line: You're going to be okay.

speaker: ANGELA
line: Yeah, that's easy for you to say.

speaker: GEORGE
line: Isn't much of a choice, really, is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're going to need water. If I'm going to deliver this baby you can put that gun down.

speaker: GEORGE
line: How do we know you're really a doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't. The truth is I've never delivered a baby before. So stand back or make yourself useful but stay out of my way.

speaker: WALTER
line: Long, even breath!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got it. Breathe... Breathe. Okay, Angela, I'm going to need you to push, okay? I need you to help me help you. Okay. So let's push.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got it. You got it. You're on the right track. I'm going to need some towels, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need some towels, damn it!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're doing good. You're doing good. Okay. You're doing good. Okay. Let's go. Okay, push.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can feel it up there!

speaker: WALTER
line: She can feel it up there!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, come on. Puuush! Good! You got it. Okay. Here it comes.

speaker: WALTER
line: Here it comes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Here it comes. It's coming. Okay.

speaker: GEORGE
line: Hey, lady, what are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the water.

speaker: WALTER
line: What? What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the water!

speaker: ANGELA
line: I'm having it! I'm having it! I'm having it!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay!

speaker: ANGELA
line: I'm having it!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Push!

speaker: ANGELA
line: I'm having it!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's coming! Push! Push!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay!

speaker: GEORGE
line: Help!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, now pick up the gun.

speaker: GEORGE
line: Help! Aah!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pick up the gun!

speaker: WALTER
line: Where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shoot out the sprinklers! Just point and shoot! Shoot out the sprinklers!

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Yes, yes. Eww, god.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: That's terrible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's official. Ten pounds, ten ounces of piss and vinegar. El nino grande-- Leroy Walter Villareal Suarez, Jr.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, no.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, yes.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh, it's amazing. It's truly amazing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: That you could come here in the face of a hurricane chasing a sea monster, yet, and end up bringing a new... life into the world. And then slaying the monster and save this one's life as he was quite literally circling down the drain.

speaker: MULDER
line: She didn't save my life, really...

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh, yes, she did. Yes, with a gun to her head, no less.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you wouldn't have known to go out in the rain if I hadn't pointed it out that to you that it was the fresh water that killed the organism...

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No no no no … I-I saw the Shipley's cat.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Uh, well, I-I can't swallow that... No, no, no.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw the cat, which had been saved which had been in the washing machine. And the Shipleys had boarded up their house which means that the only way they could have vanished was if the creature came up through the plumbing in a backwash of seawater … seawater. And then the deputy who vanished from a bathtub full of Epsom salts.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: If Agent Scully had not been there with you I shudder to think what would have happened to you. I'd say you owe her your life. It takes a big man to admit this, but... if I had had someone as savvy as her by my side all those years ago in the X-Files I might not have retired. I suggest that we have a toast to your good fortune. And I insist that we have it. So... what'll it be?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: A little of the... oh, uh... anyone for water?

speaker: MULDER AND SCULLY
line: No.
